instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with Battery low
threads.message:
I'm working on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A.
Without battery <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 8.56V.
With battery (no charger) <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 7.23V
With battery and charger <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 7.20V climbing slowly up to 8.14V (maybe more after long time)
The machine is booting with and without battery. The battery is charging,

Do you have a quick diagnose? Or do you need more information?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with Battery low
threads.message:
What's the problem, if battery is charging?
What voltage do you expect on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with battery alone?

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> slowly increases, when battery is charging.
Once fully charged, Magsafe light switch to green and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> goes to 8.5V.
